results.title: The Song of Bernadette cinema slide
results.brief_description: Glass Cinema lantern slide with black edging tape. This hand coloured slide is an advertisement for the film ‘The Song of Bernadette’ featuring Jennifer Jones and Charles Bickford produced by Twentieth Century Fox Picture. Three pieces of cream tape have been adhered to the top and bottom edges to cover cinema session details.

results.title: Under the Clock cinema slide
results.brief_description: Glass Cinema lantern slide with black edging tape and internal black frame. This hand coloured slide is an advertisement for the film ‘Under the Clock’ featuring Judy Garland by Metro Goldwyn Mayer Ltd. A piece of light brown tape has been adhered to the top edge of the image to cover session times.

results.title: Sawyer's View Master Viewing Reel - Hansel and Gretel
results.material_description: View Master viewing reel in paper envelope
results.brief_description:
View Master Viewing Reels from Sawyer’s, Inc.
FT-2 Hansel and gretel.
Originally Part 7 of P179116, individual record made for location tracking/ XOS purposes while on display (BUT it is on display in MI-08-C01 with the other reels from P179116? fmm 1/4/21)

results.title: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit glass slides (Sea Life)
results.credit_line: ACMI Collection. Donated by William Kerr on behalf of Edwin Schefferle.
results.brief_description: There are five parts to the Sea Life slides, each slide has 4 images. These small slides have red sealing tape around the edges. These slides form part of The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit with removable chimney and internal wooden block. The lantern is housed in original box with metal handle, and internal red and blue graphic for: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit. 20 glass slides in custom box, length of textile to keep box shut, 2 small empty boxes which act to store slides in a snug manner.

results.title: Mongolian Princess costume from The Last Emperor
results.brief_description:
From seller: A Mongolian Princess costume worn in the 1987 multi Oscar-winning drama The Last Emperor. This stunning costume was worn when the 15 year-old Pu-Yi (Wu Tao) wed’s the ‘old’ government chosen first wife and Empress, 17-year old Wan Jung.
The multi-layered costume consists of a thick white quilted gown with ties to the front, a red rayon brocade under robe overprinted in gold with panels in mulberry green and gold appliqué, high padded shoulders, tall collars, and cuffs trimmed in grey Astrakhan and Mongolian lambswool, and finally a waistcoat in maroon velvet and green brocade, overprinted in gold trimmed with antique fabric appliqués on the front and back panels. There are no sizes marked on this wonderful costume and it remains in excellent condition.
This comes from the private collection of renowned producer Jeremy Thomas (who single handedly raised the $25million budget for the movie) and was archived after filming completed until only recently, when the Prop Store was proud to assist in sorting and cataloguing the incredible inventory under the guidance and in collaboration with Oscar-winning Costume Designer, Jim Acheson.
